articles.title: About Us
articles.contents:
Amherst RLadies started in Fall of 2019 with a few speaker events, but we’ve expanded to holding weekly meetings to work on mini data wrangling projects. We’d love for you to join us, regardless of your gender identity! Want to join or stop by to one of our meetings or events?
Join our GroupMe for more information on what we’re up to.
Hop on our weekly Zoom (typically 8-9 PM EST for Spring 2021, but check our GroupMe for updates).
Check out our GitHub for a list of events.
Why did we start RLadies?
We wanted to create a community where people could get together to work on projects and to learn more about R, statistics, and data science.
Why do we like RLadies?
RLadies is a great community and friendly environment for everyone to learn more about statistics and do fun projects!

            About Us
            RLadies Amherst is a group that promotes gender inclusivity in statistics and data science at Amherst. We will be holding multiple events throughout the semester, including speakers, panels, and more. All are welcome to attend these events! RLadies is a world-wide organization to promote gender diversity in the R community.
            
            
            Join Us!
            Join our GroupMe! Want to join our Slack channel? Email Andrea or Jess (info at the bottom of this page)! Have suggestions for a dataset you want to look at? Let us know!
            We typically meet on Wednesdays 8-9 PM ET on our recurring Zoom link.

RLadies is a world-wide organization to promote gender diversity in the R community.
